section.title: Element: Token
section.simpara: The Token element is a body-less element that represents a single token which is a symbol or element in the tokenizer that does not or need not appear in the final AST because it is subsumed by the structured nature of the document. In other words, it represents some character or element in the serialization of the syntax that controls the structure of the code.

formalpara.title: Token contents
formalpara.para: The Token element does not contain any body elements and should be empty.

formalpara.title: Token attributes
formalpara.para:
The name attribute is the value of the token, or indicates the literal token value. The class indicates the kind of token which it is, this would be one of the following:
delimiter separator function . The last member, function, indicates that the token is a part of the function notation. The delimiter class contains all of the tokens that are paired up with one another in one form or another. The sepraator class indicates those tokens that are used to separate strings or arrays of things, which can be repeated more than once between more than two items if need be. This would include things like the statement separator and the index axis separator, the semi-colon.
